title: Winter Literacy Night!
summary: Take part in a fun night of reading and creating crafts with children!

title: John Kieran Volunteer Day
summary: Join us as we restore the beautiful John Kieran Nature Trail and the forest.

title: Eastern John Muir Volunteer Day
summary: Restore the forest through invasive removal and tree planting as well as maintenance work along the trail itself

title: Bronx: Water Aerobics Instructor For Shape Up NYC at St. Mary's recreation center
summary: NYC Parks and Recreation seeks your participation to enrich our recreation facilities! Shape Up New York is a free fitness program for all ages and is looking for additional instructors at St. Mary’s Recreation Center (St. Ann’s Avenue at East 145th street, Bronx, NY 10455)

title: Spring Volunteer Kickoff
summary: Projects throughout the Park will include tree plantings and invasive plant removal.

summary: NYC Parks and Recreation seeks your participation to enrich our recreation facilities! Shape Up New York is a free fitness program for all ages and is looking for additional instructors at St. Mary’s Recreation Center (St. Ann’s Avenue at East 145th street, Bronx, NY 10455)

title: Girl Scout Series - Bronx
summary: We are New York City’s largest girls-only youth and leadership development program where girls learn to lead with courage, confidence and character to make their communities and the world  a better place.

title: Bronx Non-Profit Legal Service Provider Seeks Interns
summary: Part of the Solution (POTS) Legal Clinic (www.potsbronx.org) serves low-income residents of the Bronx.

title: Youth Service Day: Neighborhood Festival 2011
summary: Join KHCC and Horace Mann High School for a celebration of service learning!

title: Personal Shopper
summary: Personal Shoppers work one-on-one with Dress for Success clients to help select their interview suit. Personal shopping is a wonderful way to boost women’s confidence and make a direct impact on our clients’ lives.

title: Paint and beautify a transitional residence for homeless men & women
summary: Beautify a transitional housing residence for 75 homeless men and women. We are painting the interior walls of this residence. No experience needed!

title: Science Center Open House Volunteers!
summary: The Iridescent NYC Science Studio (www.iridescentlearning.org) aims to evolve the press-and-watch science center model into a hub of design, creativity, and learning by doing. We are looking for volunteers to operate cool exhibits at our first open house!

title: Career Counselor
summary: Volunteers help our clients by reviewing and editing résumés/coverletters and giving interview tips to a woman in need. They also meet with clients to perform mock interviews and informational interviews in order to give them a chance to practice and improve their communication skills.

title: Fall Forest Restoration Volunteer Kickoff
summary: Join us as we start our fall volunteer season with events in three areas of Van Cortlandt Park

title: Garden Greeter
summary: If you wish to escape the bustling city and enjoy beautiful surroundings, get involved and become an ambassador for the greatest Botanical Garden in the world!

title: Case Management Intern
summary: In 2010, POTS’ Case Managers helped close to 1,100 people including 315 families with 300+ children identify barriers to stability and take steps to address them.  369 individuals were provided information and referrals to link with detox, educational and employment programs, shelter.

title: Tour Guide Volunteer Opportunity
summary: We are currently seeking friendly and energetic adults to be part of NYBG’s tour guide program.

title: End of Season Celebration
summary: Enjoy a taste of Van Cortandt Garden

title: It’s My Park! Day at the Friends Compost Site/Garden
summary: Come out and help us plant our garden, learn about what we are growing and turn and sift our compost bins.

title: It's My Park Day: Western John Muir Volunteer
summary: Help with a forest restoratio project along the John Muir Trail of Van Cortlandt Park

title: Administrative Assistant
summary: Volunteers help by conducting adminstrative tasks, such as answering phones, conducting data entry and processing mailings.

title: Bronx One on One Mentoring Program (BOOM)
summary: Bronx One on One Mentoring (BOOM) seeks to make a difference in the life of a child by providing amazing mentors who can serve as positive role models and guides in their lives.
org_title: Bronx One on One Mentoring Program

title: Help feed our Bronx community
summary: Momentum needs volunteers to help with a dinner program, located on East 165th Street near the Grand Concourse in the Bronx, offering a nutritious hot meal and pantry to take home, as well as social services.

title: Healthy Communities- Get Active Day
summary: Come join the Friends of Van Cortlandt Park for a day full of fun activities sure to get you outside and and moving.

title: FVCP Trail Restoration Crew
summary: Want to learn useful skills about trails planning and maintenance, while making a significant impact to the quality of Van Cortlandt Park? No prior trails experience is necessary; all training will be offered in an on-the-job format.

title: ESL Teacher Assistant
summary: work closely with NYS licensed ESL teacher to provide instruction to recently arrived immigrants. Classes are in the mornings and evenings. Requires at least 4 hours per week commitment. Teaching experience not required.

title: Million Trees NYC Community Tree Giveaway
summary: Due to popular demand the Friends are pleased to offer community members FREE trees to plant on private property.

title: Garden Crew
summary: Help care for our vegetable garden beds where all our produce will be donated to local food pantries.

title: Croton Trail Volunteer Day
summary: Help with a forest restoration project along the Old Croton Aqueduct Trail of Van Cortlandt Park

title: Donate School Supplies to Kids in the Bronx
summary: Help kids from low-income families start the school year on a positive note!

title: Fall Forest Restoration Volunteer Kickoff
summary: Volunteers needed to help remove invasive plants and plant native trees and shrubs at various locations in Van Cortlandt Park.

title: Western John Muir Volunteer Day
summary: Remove invasive plants and help native trees and shrubs.

title: Run for the Wild
summary: Make tracks for turtles in the WCS Run for the Wild at the New York Aquarium. This 5K-run and Family Fun Run takes place on the boardwalk at Coney Island on Sunday, October 9, and is dedicated to saving turtles

title: Hike-A-Thon
summary: Show your support for Van Cortlandt Park by participating in a Hike with the Friends of Van Cortlandt Park

title: Iridescent Science Studio Open House Volunteers
summary: Come out to the South Bronx to help us hold our first open house! We need volunteers to help staff the event and run educational exhibit tables. Help us express a love of learning, science, and engineering to the community in the poorest congressional district in the country.

title: Reach Out and Read-Morris Heights Health Center
summary: Reach Out and Read makes literacy promotion a standard and important part of pediatric primary care, so that children are able to grow up with access to books and are able cultivate a love of reading early on.
org_title: Reach Out and Read-Morris Heights Health Center
